creation_date: Ptolemaic Period (310 BC - 30 BC), Ptolemaic Dynasty
title: Statuette of Imhotep, Seated with Papyrus Scroll
description: This hollow cast, bronze statuette depicts the deified Egyptian architect, Imhotep, sitting with a papyrus scroll on his lap. He wears a long kilt, necklace, and a tight-fitting skull cap. Imhotep was the architect of the Pharoah, Djoser (c. 2700 BC), and is credited with designing the famous step pyramid at Saqqara. He began to be worshiped as a god during the Late Period; his cult was focused at Memphis, where he was considered to be the son of Ptah.
inscriptions: on base in pencil: 22[illegible #]; on bottom of base on label in ink: 5; on base on bottom in ink: 232
